intro: Salvia candicans, commonly known as the Mexican mint marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has square, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Salvia candicans is also valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
